body.p: If the only bonds broken during glucose oxidation were the carbon-carbon bonds, how much energy on average is contained in each mole of those carbon-carbon bonds?

part.hint: Count how many carbon-carbon bonds must be broken to convert a molecule of glucose to CO2.
Divide the total energy (kcal/mol) released by the number of bonds to get an average energy per carbon-carbon bond.

explanation.p: In a 6 carbon sugar, there are 5 carbon-carbon bonds. 673 kcal/mole divided by 5 equals approximately 135 kcal/mol per bond.
